title: CET Perceptually Uniform Colour Maps
text: 56 supported colour maps organised according attributes: Linear Diverging Rainbow Cyclic Isoluminant Colourblind

title: CET Perceptually Uniform Colour Maps
text: colour maps short name long name. shortname meant use graphing long name meant understand color map generated. shortnames created start one two characters indicate whether map : linear (l), diverging (d), rainbow (r), cyclic(c), isoluminant () colour blind (cb). , number appended end. example, linear greyscale ‘l1’, heat colour map ‘l3’, blue-white-red diverging map ‘d1’ . , see sections colourmaps visual catalog shortnames. colour map also assigned “long” named follows: Moreover, colour map name may contain cyclic shift information well indicating whether reversed flag.
code: linear_kryw_5-100_c67_n256                       /      /    |    \    \ Colour map attribute(s)     /     |     \    Number of colour map entries                            /      |      \      String indicating nominal    |       Mean chroma of colour map      hue sequence.                |                               Range of lightness values cyclic_wrwbw_90-40_c42_n256_s25_r                                           /    \                                          /   Indicates that the map is reversed.                                         /                     Percentage of colour map length                    that the map has been rotated by.

title: CET Perceptually Uniform Colour Maps
text: Please note, colormaps “deprecated” initial release. result, colormaps shortname , thus, long-name displayed. future release, likely remove color schemes.

title: CET Perceptually Uniform Colour Maps
code: # Load the Library library("cetcolor")  # Get RGB Hexadecimals for graphing cet_pal(5, name = "blues") #> [1] "#F1F1F1" "#C0D3EB" "#93B5DD" "#7197C1" "#3B7CB2"  # Sample use with ggplot2 library("ggplot2")  ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions)) +   geom_raster(aes(fill = density)) +   theme_bw() + theme(panel.grid=element_blank()) -> g  library("gridExtra")  # Frequently used colour maps have "nicknames" see ?cet_color_maps  grid.arrange(   g + scale_fill_gradientn(colours = cet_pal(5, name = "fire")),   g + scale_fill_gradientn(colours = cet_pal(5, name = "inferno")),   g + scale_fill_gradientn(colours = cet_pal(5, name = "blues")),   g + scale_fill_gradientn(colours = cet_pal(5, name = "kgy")),   ncol = 2, nrow = 2 ) # Show a panel of possible values (without nicknames) display_cet_all()

title: CET Perceptually Uniform Colour Maps
text: Location CSV data, references, data. Shorthand naming colour schemes presentation palettes Referenced documentation possible reimplementation generation functions avoid using CSV data.

title: CET Perceptually Uniform Colour Maps
text: Provides MATLAB perceptually uniform colour maps manner similar package. Function interface naming, e.g. cet_pal(n, name), colour map displays. Proper ways interface colour palettes ggplot2 shown RColorBrewer.

what: CET Perceptually Uniform Color Maps — cet_pal
title: CET Perceptually Uniform Color Maps — cet_pal
text: Extract n RGB Hexadecimal colors perceptually uniform color maps developed Peter Kovesi.

title: CET Perceptually Uniform Color Maps — cet_pal
CET Perceptually Uniform Color Maps — cet_pal
text: n numeric value greater one indicating many colors use color map. name string indicating color map use. 51 options available. Please see cet_color_maps() information. default, "rainbow" color scheme used. alpha numeric value \([0, 1]\) indicates level transparency.

title: CET Perceptually Uniform Color Maps — cet_pal
text: character vector containing RGB hexadecimal representation requested color map.

title: CET Perceptually Uniform Color Maps — cet_pal
text: Peter Kovesi. Good Colour Maps: Design . arXiv:1509.03700 cs.GR 2015

title: CET Perceptually Uniform Color Maps — cet_pal
code: # Grab 8 colors from rainbow or rainbow_bgyr_35-85_c73_n256 colors = cet_pal(8) plot(1:8, 1:8, col=colors, pch=19, cex=3, xlab="", ylab="")   # Grab 25 colors from coolwarm or diverging_bwr_40-95_c42_n256 colors = cet_pal(25, name = "coolwarm") plot(1:25, 1:25, col=colors, pch=19, cex=3, xlab="", ylab="")

what: cetcolor: CET Perceptually Uniform Colour Maps — cetcolor-package
title: cetcolor: CET Perceptually Uniform Colour Maps — cetcolor-package
text: Collection perceptually uniform colour maps made Peter Kovesi (2015) "Good Colour Maps: Design " arXiv:1509.03700 Centre Exploration Targeting (CET).

title: cetcolor: CET Perceptually Uniform Colour Maps — cetcolor-package
text: 56 Colour maps available May 2018

title: cetcolor: CET Perceptually Uniform Colour Maps — cetcolor-package
text: Maintainer: James Balamuta balamut2@illinois.edu (ORCID) [copyright holder] contributors: Peter Kovesi peter.kovesi@uwa.edu.au (Creator CET Color Maps) [copyright holder]

title: Display CET Color Maps — display_cet_pal
text: Offers variety ways preview CET Color Maps.

title: Display CET Color Maps — display_cet_pal
code: display_cet_pal(n = 256, name = "rainbow", alpha = 1)  display_cet_attribute(n = 256, attribute = "rainbow", alpha = 1)  display_cet_all(n = 256, alpha = 1)

title: Display CET Color Maps — display_cet_pal
text: n numeric value greater one indicating many colors use color map. name string indicating color map use. 51 options available. Please see cet_color_maps() information. default, "rainbow" color scheme used. alpha numeric value \([0, 1]\) indicates level transparency. attribute character string indicating attribute. Accepted values : "rainbow" (Default), "linear", "diverging", "cyclic" "isoluminant", "colorblind".
